task.title: Referring the HTML fragment from a Publishing Template

step.cmd: Create a new publishing template. Skip this step you have already one.
Open the template descriptor file associated with your publishing template. If you are not familiar with concept, you can follow the edit a publishing template procedure.
Insert the HTML content in a well-formed XML file, custom-html.html for instance.
Using the project view, copy your custom HTML fragment in an inner folder within publishing template root folder, in the custom_footer_template/html-fragments folder for instance.
step.stepresult: You should have the custom_footer_template/html-fragments/custom-html.html file in your publishing package root folder.

step.cmd: Add a reference to the custom HTML fragment in the html-fragments section of the publishing template descriptor.

info.note: If you want to insert the content in another location within the output document, you can reference the XML file from any other HTML Fragment extension points.

step.cmd: Open the DITA Map WebHelp Responsive transformation scenario.
Use the Choose Custom Publishing Template and select your newly created template.
Click OK to save the changes to the transformation scenario.

result.p: Your additional content will be included at the end of the head element of your output document.
